statements: UPDATE WaterLevels SET water_level = 100 WHERE reservoir_id = 1
UPDATE WaterLevels SET river_id = 3, river_name = 'Mississippi River' WHERE reservoir_id = 2
UPDATE WaterLevels SET water_level = 100 WHERE reservoir_id = 1
UPDATE WaterLevels SET river_name = 'River XYZ', water_level = 150, measurement_date = '2022-06-01' WHERE reservoir_id = 2
UPDATE Reservoirs SET current_level = 75.3, last_update = NOW() WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE Rivers SET water_level = 150.2, length = 300.5, last_update = '2022-01-31 15:30:00' WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE Reservoirs SET current_level = current_level + 100, last_update = NOW() WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE Rivers SET water_level = 5.75, flow_rate = flow_rate * 1.1, last_update = NOW() WHERE name = 'Amazon River';
UPDATE Reservoirs SET capacity = 10000, water_level = 7500 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE Rivers SET water_flow_rate = 25.5, length = 300 WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE Reservoirs SET capacity = 1500, water_level = 800 WHERE id = 1
UPDATE Rivers SET water_flow_rate = 120.5, length = 300 WHERE name = 'Amazon River'
UPDATE Reservoir SET name = 'New Reservoir Name', water_level = 75.3 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE River SET flow_rate = 120.5, length = 450 WHERE name = 'Mississippi River';
UPDATE Reservoir SET water_level = 75.5, capacity = 100.0 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE River SET length = 250.3, flow_rate = 120.8 WHERE name = 'Mississippi';
UPDATE Reservoirs SET current_level = 7500.20 WHERE reservoir_id = 1;
UPDATE Rivers SET flow_rate = 120.75, length = 250.00 WHERE river_id = 2;
UPDATE Reservoirs SET current_level = current_level - 500, capacity = capacity * 1.05 WHERE reservoir_id = 1;
UPDATE Rivers SET flow_rate = 150.25, length = length + 10 WHERE river_id = 3;
